title: Russian Air Base Is Attacked, as Ukraine Discounts Escalation Threat
description: Russia said falling wreckage from a Ukrainian drone had killed three servicemen at the base, some 300 miles from Ukraine, which would be the third such long-range attack this month.

title: Soccer Star Says His Family Stopped From Leaving Iran for Supporting Protests
description: Ali Daei, a prominent former soccer player, said his wife and daughter were prevented from leaving Iran on Monday after their plane made an unannounced stopover en route to Dubai.

title: How citizen spies foiled Putin’s grand plan for one Ukrainian city.
description: A partisan cell in Kherson spied on, undermined and even hunted down Russian soldiers. Now that Vladimir V. Putin’s forces are gone, people feel free to talk — and to brag a little.

title: With More Strikes in Russia, Ukraine Makes Calculation Moscow Has Reached Limit, Analysts Say
description: A drone attack over Engels air base, the latest behind Russian lines, suggests that the allure of curtailing Moscow’s missile capabilities at home outweighs any concern of escalation, analysts say.

title: Your Tuesday Briefing: China Menaces Taiwan
description: Also, an emerging picture of China’s Covid crisis.

title: Aid Groups in Afghanistan Suspend Work After the Taliban Ban Female Staff
description: The  government’s decree, barring women from work in local and international relief organizations, threatens critical assistance for millions of people.

title: China to Drop Covid Quarantine for Incoming Travelers
description: From Jan. 8, visitors will be required to show only a negative P.C.R. test taken within 48 hours. The restrictions had cut the country off from the rest of the world for nearly three years.

title: Paris Shooting Suspect Indicted on Charges of MurderWith Racist Motive
description: The suspect is accused of killing three Kurds. Prosecutors say he admitted targeting foreigners, but many Kurds see the attack as politically motivated terrorism.

title: Bakhmut’s final food stand finds a way to keep the pizza coming.
Nepal’s Revolving Door Produces a New Leader but No Hoped-For Change
description: A former rebel chief became prime minister for a third time in a country long racked by political instability.

title: With ‘Zero Covid,’ China Proved It’s Good at Control. Governance Is Harder.
description: For a powerful government that has bragged about its command of the country, its absence at a moment of crisis has made the public question its credibility.

title: What You Read
description: Today we’re looking back on the stories you read, shared and spent the most time with.

title: Nets, Buoys, Salt, Ice. For West African Fishermen, ‘Everything’ Is Going Up.
description: Fishermen in Sierra Leone need large amounts of ice to store their catch on multiday journeys. Like many commodities, it has become pricey.

title: Investigating the Nord Stream Pipeline Sabotage
description: As investigators piece together clues, Russia has quietly taken steps to begin expensive repairs on the giant gas pipeline, complicating theories about who was behind September’s sabotage.

title: With Record Military Incursions, China Warns Taiwan and U.S.
description: Taiwan said China sent 71 military aircraft near the island days after President Biden bolstered U.S. support for Taiwan.

title: North Korean Drones Breach Border, Triggering Alarms in South
description: South Korean war planes fired warning shots, while the authorities briefly prohibited commercial planes from taking off at two international airports near Seoul.

title: They Traveled From South Korea. They Got Stranded Near Buffalo.
description: A South Korean tour group’s van became stuck in the snow outside a house in Williamsville, N.Y. They spent the weekend with the residents — who luckily had a well-stocked kitchen.

title: Ukraine is offering Russian soldiers detailed instructions on how to surrender to its drones.
In Ukraine, Christmas lights defy the darkness of war.
Your Monday Briefing
description: A special edition looking back at 2022.
